intro: Echinopanax horridus subsp. japonicus, commonly known as the Japanese spurge or Japanese echinopanax, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its spiny, woody stems and lobed leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and streamside areas. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ecologically significant species in its native range.
